name: MiLE HiGH TAXi
description:
“MiLE HiGH TAXi is The Fifth Element meets Crazy Taxi”.
Fly your taxi cab in a race against time, transporting as many wacky passengers as you can.

Master the Game
The game play is simple, but mastering this game is hard! I've provided an "easy" setting. Switch to "normal" when you're ready.

Choose From 3 Different Game Play Modes
In regular mode, choose which passengers to pick up and drop off in order to maximize earnings and extend your game time and career
With Challenge mode, you'll deliver passengers sequentially to level up, as the game gets progressively more difficult
In Free Roam mode you can freely explore with no time-limits, learning the city's layout, advanced hidden shortcuts, and other secrets
Gameplay
Select a taxi and start picking up fares from super skyscrapers. Deliver them fast to keep your job and earn bonus time. Keep your eyes on the sky - especially when using Hyper Boost - you're not the only one flying these Skyways, and strange things are happening in Mile High City! Use your NavCom AI to help you navigate and find hidden customers.

Once you've learned the city, use narrow back alleys to navigate faster while blasting through skyway traffic at up to 250mph in the 600+ floor level.

MiLE HiGH TAXi is like "The Fifth Element meets Crazy Taxi". Deliver Zany Passengers, Dodge Mile-High Skyscrapers, and Blabbermouth Pedestrians in a Fast-Paced Race Against Time.

Here are some of the games I'm told are either similar, or that I took some inspiration from: Crazy Taxi, Taxi Chaos, CloudPunk, CyberPunk 2077 (I'm not sure why?), Forza, Grand Theft Auto (maybe because driving into people?), BeamNG.drive, the Coruscant scene from Star Wars, Midnight Club 3 (I'm guessing because of the architecture of the buildings), and last but not least is Taxi Simulator.
